description: Despite being in flathub beta, it's pretty stable
A fantastic alternative to Podman Desktop that feels right at home in Gnome.
summary: Great tool for managing podman containers!

description: It's an amazing example of a well-written GTK4+Adwaita app. It's not only beautiful, but also really useful. Great job!
Pods is an absolute MUST HAVE if you work with containers on the daily.
I'm currently using it on fedora silverblue. Beautiful app, works with no issues so far.
Has almost everything you need for podman administraction.

love to use this instead of the podman gui. 
libadwaita is very well implemented here.

thanks dev!
Best desktop tier container management app I've used on any platform

Presents everything you need in a simple interface that's easily controllable.

Even someone that's just starting out with Podman/containers can use Pods and understand what they're doing.

I just think the need for, and the "guide" on how to initialize the socket might be most useful if shown at the first open.

Also after initializing the socket, you'll need to restart Pods (for some reason), so Pods could tell you that you might need a restart after setting up the socket.
This really does make using Podman a pleasure using the GNOME ecosystem. It's nice to visually see things, and I have no complaints here.
Just awesome! A bit strange the portainer-tcp.service workaround for flatpak but something some needs to deal with I suppose.
